title: on me by section 22(1) and (5) of the Maritime Safety Act 2005 (No. 11 of 2005)
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Maritime Safety (Weighing of
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Maritime Safety (Weighing of 

Goods Vehicles) Regulations 2024. 

Definitions
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited maritime safety (weighing good vehicles) regulation 2024 definition

title: on me by section 22(1) and (5) of the Maritime Safety Act 2005 (No. 11 of 2005)
heading: In these Regulations –
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations – 

“Act of 2005” means Maritime Safety Act 2005 (No. 11 of 2005); 

“acceptable to the Minister” in relation to a draught gauging system, means that 
the technical requirements of the draught gauging system fitted must be in 
compliance with the details specified by the Minister for Transport in a Marine 
Notice; 

“passenger boat” and “passenger ship” have the meanings assigned to them, 
respectively, in section 2(1) of the Merchant Shipping Act 1992 (No. 2 of 1992). 

Prescribed weight
text_norm: 2 regulation - act 2005 mean maritime safety act 2005 (no 11 2005) acceptable minister relation draught gauging system mean technical requirement draught gauging system fitted must compliance detail specified minister transport marine notice passenger boat passenger ship meaning assigned respectively section 2(1) merchant shipping act 1992 (no 2 1992) prescribed weight

title: on me by section 22(1) and (5) of the Maritime Safety Act 2005 (No. 11 of 2005)
heading: 3. A weight exceeding 7,500 kilograms is the prescribed weight of a goods
text_raw:
3. A weight exceeding 7,500 kilograms is the prescribed weight of a goods 
vehicle, trailer or semi-trailer, or a goods vehicle with a trailer or semi-trailer 
attached to it, for the purposes of section 22 (1) (a) of the Act of 2005. 

Compliance exemption
text_norm: 3 weight exceeding 7 500 kilogram prescribed weight good vehicle trailer semi-trailer good vehicle trailer semi-trailer attached purpose section 22 (1) (a) act 2005 compliance exemption

title: on me by section 22(1) and (5) of the Maritime Safety Act 2005 (No. 11 of 2005)
heading: (1) All classes and types of ship are exempt from compliance with section
text_raw:
4. 

(1) All classes and types of ship are exempt from compliance with section 
22 (1) and (3) of the Act of 2005, unless the ship concerned is of a class or type 
referred to in paragraph (2). 

(2) Paragraph (1) does not apply to the following classes or types of ships: 

(a) passenger ships of Classes II(A) to VI (for the purposes of the 
Merchant Shipping (Passenger Ship Construction and Survey) 
Rules 1985 (No. 274 of 1985)), 

(b) passenger ships of Class A to Class D (to which the Merchant 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 28th June, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [316] 3 

Shipping (Passenger Ships) Rules 2020 (S.I. No. 640 of 2020)), 

(c) passenger ships of Class A to Class D (to which the European 
Union (Passenger Ships) Regulations 2019 (S.I. No. 676 of 
2019)), and 

(d) passenger boats, 

that are provided with cargo or vehicle spaces in which cargo or vehicles can be 
loaded or unloaded in the horizontal direction, engaged in the carriage of a laden 
goods vehicle, trailer or semi-trailer, not fitted with a draught gauging system 
acceptable to the Minister. 

Revocation

title: on me by section 22(1) and (5) of the Maritime Safety Act 2005 (No. 11 of 2005)
heading: 5. The Merchant Shipping (Weighing of Goods Vehicles) Regulations 2006
text_raw:
5. The Merchant Shipping (Weighing of Goods Vehicles) Regulations 2006 

(S.I. No. 510 of 2006) are revoked. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for 
Transport, 

26 June, 2024. 

EAMON RYAN, 

Minister for Transport. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [316]

title: on me by section 22(1) and (5) of the Maritime Safety Act 2005 (No. 11 of 2005)
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

These Regulations prescribe a weight greater than 7,500 kilograms as the weight 
which determines which goods vehicles, trailers or semi-trailers are prescribed 
vehicles for the purposes of section 22 of the Maritime Safety Act 2005 (i.e. the 
goods vehicles, trailers or semi-trailers in respect of which vehicle weight 
information must be given to the master of a ship by the operator of the vehicle 
prior to being loaded onto the ship in a harbour in the State and the requirement 
that such information must be retained by the owner of the vessel). The 
Regulations exempt all ships from compliance with the section 22 requirements 
except ships of those classes and types in the conditions specified in Regulation
text_norm: explanatory note (this note part instrument purport legal interpretation) regulation prescribe weight greater 7 500 kilogram weight determines good vehicle trailer semi-trailers prescribed vehicle purpose section 22 maritime safety act 2005 (i.e good vehicle trailer semi-trailers respect vehicle weight information must given master ship operator vehicle prior loaded onto ship harbour state requirement information must retained owner vessel) regulation exempt ship compliance section 22 requirement except ship class type condition specified regulation
